titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jon Butler Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Michael Lotstein

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:26

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of lecture and course notes; research materials; writings; and departmental files documenting the professional career of historian Jon Butler as educator, administrator, and author.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creator(s) of this collection for unpublished works they have authored or otherwise produced. After the lifetime of the creator(s) or until January 1, 2035, whichever comes first, copyright passes to Yale University whether such works are at Yale or physically located elsewhere in the world. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Jon Harold Butler was born June 4, 1940. He received a B.A. (1964) and a Ph.D. (1972) from the University of Minnesota. He was assistant professor of history at California State College, Bakersfield (1971-1975) and at the University of Illinois at Chicago (1975-1985). Butler has served in numerous capacities at Yale University: Professor of American Studies, History, and Religious Studies (1985-1990); Chair of the American Studies Program (1988-1993); William Robertson Coe Professor of American Studies and History (1990-2004); Director of Graduate Studies, American Studies Program (1995-1997); Director of the Division of Humanities, Faculty of Arts and Sciences (1997-1999); Chair, Department of History (1999-2004); Dean, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences (2004-2010); Acting University Librarian (2010 December-2011 July); and Howard R. Lamar Professor of American Studies, History, and Religious Studies (2004-present).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The papers are closed to researchers, excluding the donor and the following family members: Roxanne Butler, Benjamin Butler, and Peter Butler, and Caroline Butler and Naomi Butler and other sons and daughters of Benjamin and Peter as yet unborn, until January 1, 2035, or upon the death of Jon Butler, whichever occurs first, at which time the papers shall be open to all researchers.

Boxes 6-8, student papers, are closed to researchers for the life of the student plus five years (5) or seventy-five (75) years from the date the student graduates or withdraws from the University, whichever is longer.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jon Butler Papers (MS 1982). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged in four series: I. Personal Files, 1963-1992. II. Teaching Files, 1983-2010. III. Professional Files, 1972-2011. IV. Writings, 1973-2004. Series V. Electronic Records, 1994-2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of lecture and course notes; research materials; writings; departmental files; and electronic records documenting the professional career of historian Jon Butler as educator, administrator, and author.

did.unittitle: Newberry Library Family and Community History Summer Training Institute
University of Minnesota course work of Jon Butler

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Course work includes bibliographies, research materials, and book reviews written by Jon Butler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Research materials and papers on ministers and baptism in seventeenth-century Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Darrett Rutman was one of Butler's dissertation advisers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Course materials are arranged alphabetically by course title and chronologically therein.

did.unittitle: RelSt 490, Approaches to the Study of Religion

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Student papers are arranged alphabetically by student name. Folders may also contain related correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 6-8, student papers, are restricted until January 1, 2086 as established by Yale Corporation regulations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files include correspondence, reports, enrollment statistics, administrative procedures, and related topics.

did.unittitle: National Endowment for the Humanities grant, "New World Civilizations"

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files may contain papers presented, research materials, printed ephemera, and related correspondence for events in which Butler served as either chairperson, presenter, moderator, committee member, or attendee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain correspondence, annual reports, draft proposals, budgets, "Pew Notes," and related materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain correspondence, monthly/quarterly reports, guidelines for publication, statistics, and related materials from Butler's tenure as a member of the editorial board, 1992-1995, and as chair of the board, 1994-1995.

did.unittitle: William and Mary Quarterly and the Institute of Early American History and Culture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain correspondence, meeting minutes, annual reports, and related materials from Butler's tenure as member of the Council of the Institute of Early American History and Culture, 1992-1995, and secretary, 1994-1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain reproductions and negatives of photographs used in Butler's published work. Listed by plate # and/or chapter number.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by plate number. There is no plate 13.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by chapter number in which item appears.

did.unittitle: Articles, review essays, and book chapters

"Two 1642 Letters from Virginia Puritans," edited by Butler, Proceedings, Massachusetts Historical Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files contain materials related to Butler's works, including outlines; synopses; drafts; publicity; readers' reports and responses; reviews, correspondence with publishers; research materials; jacket cover designs; permissions; and similar items. Contents of folders may vary from book to book.

scopecontent.p: A multi-volume historical series for adolescents, co-edited by Jon Butler and Harry S. Stout, Oxford University Press.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A volume in the Religion in American Life series.

scopecontent.p: Includes review of "Witchcraft, Healing and Historians' Crazes"

did.unittitle: Submission critiques by American Historical Review

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Electronic records include extensive email correspondence; materials related to Butler's writing and publishing career; speech, lecture and conference session notes; teaching files; personal papers; and files pertaining to his tenure as both Dean of the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences and Acting University Librarian at Yale.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
